Quotes: I never had a policy;I have just tried to do my very best each and every day.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: If I were to try to read, much less answer, all the attacks made on me, this shop might as well be closed for any other business.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Whenever I hear anyone arguing for slavery, I feel a strong impulse to see it tried on him personally.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: To sin by silence when they should protest makes cowards of men.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: The dogmas of the quiet past are inadequate to the stormy present. The occasion is piled high with difficulty, and we must rise with the occasion. As our case is new, so we must think anew and act anew.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Real nobility is based on scorn, courage, and profound indifference.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: What is a rebel? A man who says no.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: It is a miracle that curiosity survives formal education.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: I am not only a pacifist but a militant pacifist. I am willing to fight for peace. Nothing will end war unless the people themselves refuse to go to war.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: In order to be an immaculate member of a flock of sheep, one must above all be a sheep oneself.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Only the unknown frightens men. But once a man has faced the unknown, that terror becomes the known.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

Quotes: Fear is pain arising from the anticipation of evil.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: Never confuse motion with action.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Dignity, and even holiness too, sometimes, are more questions of coat and waistcoat than some people imagine.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: I have no further use for America. I wouldn't go back there if Jesus Christ was President.
Author: Charlie Chaplin

Quotes: Whatever you do, do with all your might.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: True nobility is exempt from fear.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Though silence is not necessarily an admission, it is not a denial, either.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: When you have no basis for an argument, abuse the plaintiff.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Orators are most vehement when their cause is weak.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quotes: An oppressive government is more to be feared than a tiger.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: Speech and silence. We feel safer with a madman who talks than with one who cannot open his mouth.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Who Rebels? Who rises in arms? Rarely the slave, but almost always the oppressor turned slave.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: Power is given only to those who dare to lower themselves and pick it up. Only one thing matters, one thing;to be able to dare!
Author: Fiodor Mihailovici Dostoevski

Quotes: Only the contemptible fear contempt.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Dread of night. Dread of not-night.
Author: Franz Kafka

Quotes: The press, the machine, the railway, the telegraph are premises whose thousand-year conclusion no one has yet dared to draw.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: If you can't get rid of the skeleton in your closet, you'd best teach it to dance.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: If you cannot get rid of the family skeleton, you may as well make it dance.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: In this world there is always danger for those who are afraid of it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: The quickest way of ending a war is to lose it.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: It is easy to sit up and take notice, What is difficult is getting up and taking action.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: The coward only threatens when he is safe.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: To appreciate the noble is a gain which can never be torn from us.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Be above it! Make the world serve your purpose, but do not serve it.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: If it's your job to eat a frog, it's best to do it first thing in the morning. And If it's your job to eat two frogs, it's best to eat the biggest one first.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: There are several good protections against temptation, but the surest is cowardice.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: If you can't feed a hundred people, then feed just one.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quotes: One change always leaves the way open for the establishment of others.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quotes: If an injury has to be done to a man it should be so severe that his vengeance need not be feared.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quotes: The basis of optimism is sheer terror.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: There are many things that we would throw away if we were not afraid that others might pick them up.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: We are twice armed if we fight with faith.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Those who own much have much to fear.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quotes: Let us not pray to be sheltered from dangers but to be fearless when facing them.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quotes: If you don't like what you're doing, then don't do it.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: In matters of style, swim with the current;in matters of principle, stand like a rock.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: Every citizen should be a soldier. This was the case with the Greeks and Romans, and must be that of every free state.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: Curiosity is one of the forms of feminine bravery.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: Arrange whatever pieces come your way.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: Fear follows crime and is its punishment.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: The attempt and not the deed confounds us.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Our doubts are traitors and make us lose the good we oft might win by fearing to attempt.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Things done well and with a care, exempt themselves from fear.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: As he was valiant, I honour him. But as he was ambitious, I slew him.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: What, man, defy the devil. Consider, he's an enemy to mankind.
Author: William Shakespeare
